sections.heading: Acura Paint Color Code by VIN – Decode Your Vehicle’s Colors Effortlessly
sections.content: When it comes to maintaining or customizing your Acura, knowing your vehicle's exact paint color is essential. Whether you’re looking for Acura touch-up paint or planning a full restoration, the best way to find the accurate color is by decoding your Acura paint color code using your VIN (Vehicle Identification Number). This guide will help you locate your Acura’s paint code, understand the difference between interior and exterior color codes, and ensure your car looks its best.

sections.heading: What Is an Acura Paint Color Code?
sections.content:
Every Acura vehicle comes with a specific paint code that identifies its exact color. These codes help you find the perfect match for repairs or touch-ups. Acura’s paint codes cover both interior and exterior colors, ensuring you maintain your vehicle’s original aesthetics.

Some popular Acura paint colors include:

  • NH-797M (Modern Steel Metallic)
  • B-588P (Apex Blue Pearl)
  • YR-596P (Canyon Bronze Metallic)

sections.heading: Where to Find the Acura Paint Code?
sections.content:
Finding your Acura paint code is simple if you know where to look.

Acura Paint Code Location

The paint code is typically found:

  • On the driver’s side door jamb.
  • Inside the owner’s manual.
  • On the VIN sticker under the hood.

The code will often be listed as “Paint” or “PNT” followed by alphanumeric characters.

sections.heading: How to Use the VIN to Find Your Acura Paint Color Code
sections.content:
The VIN is a 17-character code that serves as your vehicle’s unique fingerprint. By decoding your Acura’s VIN, you can access detailed information, including its paint color.

Steps to Decode Acura Paint Color by VIN:

  1. Locate your VIN (on the dashboard, driver’s door frame, or vehicle title).
  2. Use the Acura Paint Code Decoder tool on VIN Decoder (www.chassisvin.com/vin-decoder).
  3. Enter the VIN and receive detailed paint color information.

sections.heading: Facts About Acura Color Codes
sections.content:
• Standardized Format: Acura uses a universal system to simplify touch-up paint orders.
  • Interior vs. Exterior Codes: Acura interior color codes differ from the exterior paint codes.

sections.heading: Understanding Audi Color Codes: Location and Identification
sections.content:
Knowing the location of your Audi's paint code is important to ensure an accurate match when purchasing touch-up paint. Here's how to locate it:

Audi Paint Code Location

Audi places the paint code on a label that is typically found in one of several locations:

  • Inside the driver’s side door frame: Look for a small sticker or plaque with your vehicle’s information, including the Audi paint code.
  • On the driver’s side front strut tower: For some models, the paint code can be found in the engine compartment.
  • In the trunk: Some Audis have a label inside the trunk or under the carpet.

The code will often be a combination of letters and numbers (e.g., LY7W for Ibis White). You can then use this code to find your car’s exact paint color.

Audi Interior and Exterior Color Codes

Your Audi comes with color codes for both interior and exterior colors. The Audi exterior color code identifies the specific color of your car’s body paint, while the Audi interior color code identifies the trim, upholstery, and other interior elements like dashboard panels and seats.

Understanding both codes ensures that all aspects of your car’s color scheme are coordinated, especially for those seeking to customize or restore their vehicle.

sections.heading: Examples of Popular Audi Color Codes
sections.content:
Here are a few popular Audi paint color codes you may encounter:

  • Ibis White (LY9C)
  • Mythos Black (L8Z1)
  • Nano Grey (LZ7G)
  • Daytona Grey (LZ7C)
  • Tango Red (LZ3F)

These codes are used to help identify specific colors for different models, so when you decode Audi paint colors using your VIN, you'll be sure to get the exact match for your vehicle.

sections.heading: Facts About Audi Color Codes

  • Easy to Find: By simply using the VIN, you can locate the exact color code, eliminating the guesswork when ordering touch-up paint.

sections.heading: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) About Audi Paint Color Codes
sections.content:
• How can I find my Audi’s paint code? To find your Audi’s paint code, you’ll need to locate the VIN (Vehicle Identification Number) and use a VIN decoder tool. The code is usually located on a label inside the driver’s side door frame, the engine compartment, or in the trunk area.
  • Can I use the same paint code for both interior and exterior? No. Audi provides separate color codes for interior and exterior paint. Be sure to look up both codes for a complete understanding of your vehicle’s color scheme.
  • Where can I purchase Audi touch-up paint? Once you have your Audi paint code, you can purchase Audi touch-up paint from authorized dealers or online retailers that specialize in automotive supplies.
  • What should I do if I can’t find my Audi’s paint code? If you're having trouble finding the paint code, try using a VIN lookup service. You can also consult with an Audi dealer for assistance in locating the correct code.
  • Are Audi color codes the same across all models? No. Each Audi model may have a different set of available colors, so it's important to use the exact VIN to decode the correct color for your specific vehicle.
  • Can I change my Audi’s paint color? Yes, you can repaint your Audi, but make sure to choose the correct Audi paint code for a perfect match to your original color. Consult a professional for the best results when repainting.

sections.heading: What is Hyundai Paint Color Code?

Hyundai touch up paint is also available for many models to maintain that factory-fresh look.

sections.heading: How to Find the Hyundai Paint Code by VIN

One of the easiest ways to identify your Hyundai paint code is by checking the VIN (Vehicle Identification Number). The VIN is typically located on the dashboard near the driver's side windshield, on a small metal plate, or inside the driver’s side door frame on a sticker. For Hyundai vehicles, the paint code is often found on the same sticker.

To locate your Hyundai color code, follow these steps:

Hyundai vehicles come with both interior color codes and exterior color codes. While the exterior color code reflects the paint used on the body, the interior color code corresponds to the upholstery, trim, and other interior finishes.

Exterior color codes represent the color of the car’s body, such as popular shades like Hyundai white, blue, or black.

Interior Color Codes

Interior color codes indicate the color of the seat upholstery, dashboards, and other internal elements. Common colors include Hyundai gray, black, or beige.

By knowing both codes, you can match your Hyundai interior color code and Hyundai exterior color code when looking for matching parts or accessories.

sections.heading: KTM Paint Color Code by VIN – Decode Your Vehicle’s Colors
sections.content: To restore or customize your KTM, knowing the exact paint color is crucial. Using your Vehicle Identification Number (VIN), you can easily decode the KTM paint color code and get accurate results for your bike’s touch-up paint, as well as interior and exterior colors. Whether you’re fixing minor chips or repainting, this guide will ensure you get the correct color match for a seamless result.

sections.heading: What is a KTM Paint Color Code?
sections.content:
A KTM paint color code is a unique identifier that corresponds to the exact color of your vehicle. Whether it's for touch-up paint or a complete repaint, the KTM paint color code ensures your bike's color matches perfectly. KTM's color codes cover both interior and exterior colors to maintain consistency and aesthetic appeal.

Some popular KTM paint codes include:

  • R121 (Orange)
  • B112 (Black)
  • W102 (White)

sections.heading: Where to Find the KTM Paint Code?
sections.content:
Locating your KTM paint code is simple if you know where to look. The code can typically be found on the VIN label or other parts of the vehicle.

KTM Paint Code Location

Common locations for your KTM paint code include:

  • On the VIN sticker, typically found under the seat or frame
  • In the owner's manual or maintenance book
  • On a label inside the door frame or handle area

The paint code is often identified with the term 'PNT' or 'Color Code'.

sections.heading: How to Use the VIN to Find Your KTM Paint Color Code
sections.content:
Your KTM's VIN is a 17-character code that contains crucial information about your vehicle, including its paint color. By decoding your VIN, you can quickly find your KTM paint color code.

Steps to Decode KTM Paint Color Code by VIN:

  1. Locate your VIN (usually on the dashboard, near the windshield, or inside the frame).
  2. Use the KTM Paint Code Decoder tool on the VIN Decoder page.
  3. Enter your VIN to get detailed results, including the exact paint code and additional vehicle details.

sections.heading: Facts About KTM Color Codes
sections.content:
• Unique Codes: KTM uses distinct codes for both interior and exterior colors.
  • Quick Match: Accurate decoding ensures perfect touch-up or repainting results.
  • Custom Paints: Special edition KTM bikes may have exclusive color codes for their unique designs.

KTM Interior Color Codes

KTM's interior color codes represent the colors of seats, trim, and other internal components. Examples of popular KTM interior colors include:

  • Y162 (Black Upholstery)
  • O171 (Grey Trim)

KTM Exterior Color Codes

sections.heading: What is a Peugeot Paint Color Code by VIN?

Every Peugeot vehicle is assigned a unique paint code that identifies its exact color. This code is typically found on the vehicle’s build sheet and is linked to your Vehicle Identification Number (VIN). By decoding your Peugeot VIN, you can access the exact Peugeot color codes, including both exterior and interior shades.

If you're in need of touch-ups or want to know more about the original color used for your vehicle, the Peugeot color code location can help you find the necessary information.

sections.heading: Where to Find Your Peugeot Paint Code
sections.content:
The Peugeot paint code location can vary depending on the model and year of your vehicle. Common spots for finding the paint code include:

  • Inside the driver's side door frame (on the door’s jamb or near the door latch)
  • Under the hood (near the front of the car or on the firewall)
  • In the glove box (on a label or sticker)
  • On the build sheet (often available from your dealer)

Knowing the correct location of your Peugeot paint code is crucial for matching the exact color of your vehicle for repairs or touch-ups.

Interior colors might include options like black, grey, or beige, while exterior colors cover a variety of hues such as white, silver, and red. When you decode your Peugeot VIN, you will be able to see both the Peugeot exterior color code and Peugeot interior color code.
